pros: Everything from benefits, to coworkers, to students
cons: Nothing to report here at all

pros: Most Bellarmine staff and faculty are very nice.
cons: There are major budget issues at Bellarmine. The university is working hard to find solutions, so significant cuts are happening. Retirement benefits are far below what other universities offer, raises are not happening, and when employees leave, they are largely not being replaced. The plan for correction involves recruiting more students, which Bellarmine has been trying to do for many years.

pros: Beautiful campus, great people, PTO
cons: Low Salary, BU is a financial disaster, I think a lot of people have lost faith in the current president.

review_title: Committed co workers good work life balance
pros: None at this time for now
cons: Salary is low compared to others with little room for growth

job_title: Part Time Adjunct Instructor in Louisville, KY
pros: flexible schedule, friendly co-workers, nice facilities, great students
cons: Pay schedule, Tough to keep on-campus office hours

job_title: Graduate Assistant Coach in Louisville, KY
pros: You get up to 2 full classes paid for per semester
cons: Slow moving administration allows down the job and there is active discrimination in the workplace.

job_title: Public Safety Sergeant in Louisville, KY
pros: The education and reputation of the university is top quality!
cons: The lack of leadership and power politics of the public safety department does not match the high standards of the university at all. Most of the department doesn’t even have a degree but yet they represent a higher education institution.

pros: Bueatiful Campus, many smart students, small class size.
cons:
Part-time and adjunct professors are treated poorly, zero support, ill equiped labs.
If you a person of color/different faith you are expected to bow, or you will be singled out and experience racism.
Spinless management will not stand up for the integrity of the university allows bad/failure/racist students to lead without any question.
Some management will exploit an issue to climb not to solve, others will instigate students to create a problem for their own agenda.
Supremacist, and secret societies, Zionist are in the front seat, they can create a problem for you if you do not conform.
They talk about diversity in principle but practically does not exist.

pros: Faculty is friendly and attempts to promote academic rigor.
cons: Cabinet is made up primarily of higher ed administrators and not academics. Faculty is low on the pecking order

pros: Good People. well established reputation
cons: Higher Ed challenges as at all schools

pros: Free tuition, generous benefits including vacation time, Holidays, 2 weeks off at Christmas.
cons: Generally lower salaries than same position in private sector

review_title: Tight-Knit Community with the Usual Issues in  Higher Education
pros: Strong community, lively campus, students are great, new President is moving in the right Direction
cons: No room for advancement for younger professionals, Senior leadership and governing boards are out of touch with the younger generations, decisions are made without the newer and younger professionals in mind (i.e. Salary Cuts, Benefit Reductions, "the Bellarmine Way," etc.). Divide between treatment of faculty and staff, especially regarding Covid. Pays less than a public school.

pros: The people and the culture - high-paying for a student position
cons: No cons - BU is a great place to work

pros: Great colleagues and staff. Wonderful students.
cons: Don’t value the experience of adjunct instructors.

review_title: Nice folks - you will be worked to death
pros: Overall nice campus, good coworkers
cons: Overloaded each year with no pay raise

pros: There’s a strong community that thrives on building you up as a person and working as a team.
cons: No opportunity for growth without a Masters Degree

job_title: Residence Life Coordinator in Louisville, KY
pros: Apartment, Campus, Students, Division of Student Affairs
cons: Retirement Benefits, On-Call Rotation, No Meal Plan

review_title: Good regional university with big aspirations, but resistance to change and outsiders
pros: Most faculty, staff, students and alumni are great to work with; family-friendly culture and activities; good work-life balance; best private university in Louisville region; decent benefits package; half-day Fridays in the summer and closed for winter holidays
cons: President has accomplished a lot in 20+ years, but makes way too much money for a school its size; culture can be closed and unwelcoming to outsiders; communication from the top and within schools, divisions and departments can be very poor; unwilling to invest in critical resources for the benefit of students and alumni; no upward mobility or plans to develop future leadership; low pay

pros: I have holidays off and some people are nice.
cons: There is a severe lack of career growth and the compensation is a joke. There is no sense of family at all. If you are new, don't expect to be immediately accepted. The small intimate campus is just that, they do not accept newcomers well at all, very clickish. People are set in their ways and change is not accepted. You will feel stuck, unappreciated and question your reasoning for being at Bellarmine whenever your come to campus.

cons: I have not encountered any drawbacks with this opportunity.

pros: Feels like family. Good management. Excellent benefits.
cons: Salary isn't amazing. Sometimes the fact that it is a small community is a downside because there's a tendency to gossip.

pros: Good pay, superiors, and atmosphere. The students are great.
